1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (07:51): 70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shiv_(weapon)

70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (07:52): http://sandbox.thewikies.com/html5-experiments/phase-01.html

70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (07:52): "The term shiv originates from John Resig, the creator of jQuery, who used the word as a metaphor to describe shiving support for HTML5 elements into Internet Explorer via javascript, where shiving is a slang term for a sharp object used as a knife-like weapon. There's also a chance that John had a moment of false etymology and meant to use the word shim, which in computing means an application compatibility workaroun
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (07:52): d."
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (07:56): so I take it my attempt to combine gang and HTML language didn‚Äôt quite work out?

1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:01): indeedy. I shoulda taken the photos yesterday, but oh well
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (08:01): so, on the subject of whatwg and html5, 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f have you seen http://sandbox.thewikies.com/html-templates/html5.html ?
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (08:02): or any of the other templates in that directory?
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:06): 70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132: are these general purpose or for internal use?
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (08:07): I'd like to use them to share.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (08:07): And for all projects I start.
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:08): you‚Äôd probably want to start with a bunch of things commented out if shared (eg viewport, apple touch icon)
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:09): #content seems suitable for section or article depending on content
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (08:10): it focuses on all the basics you might use.
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:11): for the microdata itemprop="fn org" won‚Äôt map to any text in output (you ‚Äôd need to change to eg CSS image replacement
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:13): that‚Äôs about all I can say without seeing content. good base
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (08:13): what
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (08:13): i didn't do that
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (08:14): wait, i thought you said something else
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (08:14): why is that bad what I did?
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:14): what specifically?
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (08:14): it will map the alt text of the img
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (08:14): I remember this, specifically.
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:15): 70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132: oh really. huh. didn‚Äôt realise that. thanks
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (08:15): Because I was originally putting it on the img itself, and there was this feud over that.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (08:15): that fn org shouldn't be expected to read the alt text for an image
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (08:15): but from the container, it was okay.
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:15): looks like I haven‚Äôt microdata‚Äôed any images yet
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (08:16): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f, any validators / readers on the web?
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:16): foolip‚Äôs Live Microdata tis all atm http://foolip.org/microdatajs/live/
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:16): luckily it‚Äôs pretty good
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (08:18): it doesn't like what i did.
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:19): checking microdata spec
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:24): guess alt text is the img element‚Äôs textContent
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:26): Hixie: so for an image is the img element‚Äôs textContent it‚Äôs alt text?
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:26): (or anyone else)
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:27): 70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132: oh yeah, the \t\n is because it acts like <pre>  so whitespace is significant. not sure this is a good thing actually
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:30): might email the list about this
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (08:47): 70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132: mind if I include that template in an email to WHATWG list?
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (08:49): yea, use any part of it
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (08:49): totally
